fields.description:
I registered 7 UFS nodes and started them at the same time. The time from the nodes being up (web service started) to the time the CLC saw them ENABLED was around 10 minutes.

There are 1624 Postgres processes running:
{noformat}
[root@g-15-08 ~]# ps aux | grep postgres | wc -l
1624
[root@g-15-08 ~]#
{noformat}
fields.summary: Using 7 User Facing Services causes slowness on bootstrap

comments.body:
Connections dont seem to be held up:

{noformat}
[root@g-15-08 ~]# euca-modify-property -peuca='org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxoolFacade.with{ getAliases().collect{ String alias -> "\n" +
                 alias + "\t" + getSnapshot(alias,true).with{ getActiveConnectionCount() + "/" + getConnectionCount() } } }'
PROPERTY        euca    [
eucalyptus_cloud        0/10,
eucalyptus_imaging      0/9,
eucalyptus_records      0/9,
eucalyptus_autoscaling  0/9,
eucalyptus_storage      0/9,
eucalyptus_osg  0/9,
eucalyptus_cloudwatch   0/9,
eucalyptus_general      0/9,
eucalyptus_auth 0/11,
database_events 0/9,
eucalyptus_loadbalancing        0/9,
eucalyptus_config       0/28,
eucalyptus_cloudformation       0/9,
eucalyptus_dns  0/9,
eucalyptus_walrus       0/9,
eucalyptus_faults       0/9,
eucalyptus_reporting    0/9] was executed successfully.
[root@g-15-08 ~]#
{noformat}

I was not able to reproduce this issue, I tried the following scenarios with 5 UFS hosts:

* Restart eucalyptus-cloud service on all UFS hosts
* Deregister and re-register all user-api services
* Deregister all user-api services, restart eucalyptus-cloud service on all UFS hosts and register without waiting for service restart to complete
* Deregister all user-api services, restart eucalyptus-cloud service on all UFS hosts and register after waiting for service restart to complete
* Restart CLC

In all cases the services returned to enabled in under 5 minutes.
Issues seen in an HA configuration may be due to EUCA-7141.

This still exists in some shape/form. I am seeing with 7 UFS that things are taking more than 10 minutes. 

What is the expected transition time of services? I think we should punt this to 4.0.2 regardless as 4.0.1 is ready to go out the door already.
[~sjones] if youd like to poke the system you can hop on to 10.111.5.155
Was able to reproduce on my system. Going to punt this one for now to the next maint release and hopefully I can reproduce and hand over earlier in the release cycle.
[~viglesias], please reproduce this using the 4.0.x testing branch and I'll take a look.
EUCA-9308, is a similar issue, but with EUCA-9308 the OSG will remain in the BROKEN state until the eucalyptus-cloud service is restarted on that host.

Hosts with the issue are deadlocked when restarting web services:

{code}
"Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Futures.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#73" prio=10 tid=0x00007f15bc006800 nid=0x239f waiting for monitor entry [0x00007f1569251000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices.clientChannelFactory(WebServices.java:258)
        - waiting to lock <0x000000079a44ceb8> (a java.lang.Class for com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices.clientBootstrap(WebServices.java:238)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequestHandler.fire(AsyncRequestHandler.java:126)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequest.execute(AsyncRequest.java:278)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequest.sendSync(AsyncRequest.java:270)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.fireCallback(Cluster.java:465)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.access$700(Cluster.java:175)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster$LogRefresh$1.leave(Cluster.java:339)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster$LogRefresh$1.leave(Cluster.java:335)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionImpl.leave(TransitionImpl.java:218)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState$ActiveTransition.leave(AtomicMarkedState.java:524)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.afterLeave(AtomicMarkedState.java:342)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.transition(AtomicMarkedState.java:185)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:141)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:126)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:194)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:181)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:194)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:181)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:194)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:181)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:194)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:181)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.start(Cluster.java:896)
        at com.eucalyptus.cluster.ClusterBuilder.fireStart(ClusterBuilder.java:125)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$ServiceRemoteTransitionNotification$4.fire(ServiceTransitions.java:753)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.processTransition(ServiceTransitions.java:360)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.access$000(ServiceTransitions.java:123)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:412)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:379)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionImpl.leave(TransitionImpl.java:218)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState$ActiveTransition.leave(AtomicMarkedState.java:524)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.afterLeave(AtomicMarkedState.java:342)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.transition(AtomicMarkedState.java:185)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:136)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:83)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:141)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:126)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3$1.run(Futures.java:215)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
{code}

{code}
"main" prio=10 tid=0x0000000000e0e000 nid=0x213c waiting on condition [0x00007fff562ae000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
        at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
        - parking to wait for  <0x00000007a75396e0> (a java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch$Sync)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:834)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireSharedInterruptibly(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:994)
        at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireSharedInterruptibly(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1303)
        at java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch.await(CountDownLatch.java:236)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioSelector.shutdown(AbstractNioSelector.java:399)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.shutdown(NioWorker.java:36)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.AbstractNioWorkerPool.shutdown(AbstractNioWorkerPool.java:120)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketChannelFactory.shutdown(NioServerSocketChannelFactory.java:210)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioServerSocketChannelFactory.releaseExternalResources(NioServerSocketChannelFactory.java:217)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices$2.run(WebServices.java:350)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices.restart(WebServices.java:295)
        - locked <0x000000079a44ceb8> (a java.lang.Class for com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServices$WebServicesBootstrapper.load(WebServices.java:138)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.Bootstrap$Stage.load(Bootstrap.java:304)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper$2.apply(SystemBootstrapper.java:232)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper$2.apply(SystemBootstrapper.java:228)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper.runSystemStages(SystemBootstrapper.java:287)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper.load(SystemBootstrapper.java:228)
{code}
The fix works around the deadlock by using separate locks for web services client and server resources so there is no contention between bootstrapping the client and restarting the service.

I was unable to see any prolonged times when restarting eucalyptus-cloud process of the CLC or all 6 remote UFS hosts.  Times averaged 3-4 minutes for the system to be totally enabled.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64

Release     : 0.0.22283.41.20141012git6f021f0.el6
